data.title: WHA Group" reports 71% YoY profit rise to THB 3,312M
data.description: “WHA Group” Reports Strong 9-Month Normalized Profit of THB 3,312 Million in 2024, Up 71% YoY; Interim Dividend of THB 0.0669 per Share Was Approved with XD Date Set for 21 November. Expect to Close Additional Data Center Deals, Reaffirming Thailand as a Key Investment Hub

data.title: Arumugam Kandasamy, Malaysian worker on 'Death Railway', dies at 97
data.description: The oldest surviving worker of the infamous 'Death Railway' between Thailand and Myanmar, Arumugam Kandasamy, has died at the age of 97.

data.title: Arumugam Kandasamy, worker on infamous 'Death Railway', dies at 97
data.description: SEREMBAN: The oldest surviving worker of the infamous 'Death Railway' between Thailand and Myanmar, Arumugam Kandasamy, has died at the age of 97.

data.title: As children face unprecedented challenges worldwide, UNICEF calls for united action towards A Better Tomorrow, Today
data.description: BANGKOK, 7 November 2024 – UNICEF Thailand today launches A Better Tomorrow, a public campaign calling on society to come together to create a safer, healthier, and more hopeful future for every child. In a world of escalating conflicts, health crises, poverty, inequality, and climate-related disasters, UNICEF is urging immediate action to uphold children’s rights and help every child reach their full potential.

data.title: Taiwan targets 'peanuts' for political motive
data.description: Mainland blasts ban on import of spicy snack popular among Taiwan residents

data.title: Myanmar Embassy in Thailand announces entry ban for overstayers based on duration of overstay
data.description: The Myanmar Embassy in Thailand announced on November 8 that overstayers in Thailand will be banned from re-entering Thailand based on the duration of overstay.

data.description: Mainland blasts ban on import of spicy snack popular among Taiwan residents

data.title: Two pandas to arrive from China by 2027
data.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MNRE) is expected to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) next year on the transfer of two pandas from China, says permanent secretary Jatuporn Buruspat.

data.title: Prawit suffers landslide defeat in TAA election
data.description: Gen  Prawit Wongsuwon  suffered a landslide defeat as his bid to take over the reins of the Thailand Aquatics Association (TAA) came a cropper Saturday.

data.title: Fornazari stars as Sukhothai down Nongbua
data.description: Sukhothai put on an impressive show to hammer Nongbua Pitchaya 5-2 in a Thai League 1 clash on Friday night.

data.title: DNP submits controversial forest bills to cabinet
data.description: The Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP) will submit two draft laws to the cabinet next week, despite opposition from the People

data.title: Govt officials to  drive F1 race  talks forward
data.description: The government has vowed to bring a  Formula 1  (F1) racing event to Thailand to stimulate economic growth.

data.title: Peru envoy hails PM's trip as chance to boost bilateral, Apec ties
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra

data.title: Govt under pressure over maritime MoU
data.description: The controversial 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  to jointly develop parts of an  overlapping claim area  (OCA) and set a maritime boundary continues to cast a shadow over Thailand.

data.title: Govt under pressure over maritime MoU
data.description: The controversial 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  to jointly develop parts of an  overlapping claim area  (OCA) and set a maritime boundary continues to cast a shadow over Thailand.

data.title: Rodtang ‘almost started another fight’ with Takeru, apologises for ONE Championship weight miss
data.description: Rodtang Jitmuangnon put his ONE Championship weight miss behind him with a crowd-pleasing exhibition on Saturday that set up a long-awaited showdown with Takeru Segawa.

data.title: China and Indonesia to sign deals worth $10bn
data.description: BEIJING - Chinese and Indonesian companies will sign business agreements totalling more than $10 billion on Sunday, President Prabowo Subianto said as he met his counterpart Xi Jinping in Beijing during a state visit on Saturday.

data.title: Thai deputy PM makes case for Cambodia deal
data.description: TRAT - The government on Saturday reiterated that a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  is a mechanism to protect Thailand’s best interests, while insisting Thailand has sole  sovereignty  over  Koh Kut  in this eastern province.

data.title: Three overpasses in Central Bangkok to be demolished for Orange Line construction
data.description: Infrastructure systems and right-of-way areas will be relocated, leading to traffic diversions, starting November 15

data.title: Investigators tracking lawyer Sittra’s money trail
data.description: The Anti-Money Laundering Office (Amlo) is in talks with police investigators about tracking the money trail and assets of the high-profile lawyer  Sittra Biabungkerd  and his wife, who are facing charges of  fraud  and  money laundering .

data.title: Rockslide threatens Swiss village again
data.description: VIENNA - A small Swiss village that attracted global attention last year when it was evacuated because the mountain face above it threatened to collapse onto it must be evacuated again, local officials said on Saturday.

data.title: Tourism industry rebound fuels investment in Thailand's hotel sector
data.description: New hotels strategically located in popular tourist destinations such as Phuket, Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Samui

data.title: Airport on alert for Loy Krathong risk
data.description: The public has been urged to refrain from flying lanterns or balloons, setting off  fireworks  or using lasers near and around  Suvarnabhumi Airport  during the  Loy Krathong  festival this coming Friday.

data.title: Annual red-cloth ceremony held at Golden Mount
data.description: Event part of annual temple fair running from November 8-17, centuries-old tradition honouring the Buddha’s relics

data.title: Two pandas to arrive from China by 2027
data.description: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment expects to sign an agreement next year on the transfer of two  pandas  from China, according to permanent secretary Jatuporn Buruspat.

data.title: Siam Piwat lines up a range of activities as part of year-end festivities
data.description: Siam Paragon, Siam Center, and Siam Discovery are gearing up to enchant visitors with a dazzling array of festive events and experiences in Bangkok, Siam Piwat group said on Saturday.

data.title: Property developer AssetWise grooves marketing strategy to a new beat

data.title: Declining seagrass habitats posing an existential threat to dugongs
data.description: Following 8 deaths in October, Thai marine scientists working on project to cultivate seagrass beds

data.title: Pakistan separatists kill 24 in train station blast
data.description: QUETTA, Pakistan - At least 24 people were killed and more than 40 injured in a bomb blast at a railway station in Quetta in southwestern Pakistan on Saturday, police and other officials told Reuters.

data.title: Rifle used in Narathiwat murder linked to 24 cases
data.description: A military rifle used to kill the mayor of a tambon in Narathiwat has been traced to more than 20 different criminal cases throughout the southern region of Thailand.

data.title: Travellers invited to enjoy ‘Ozone Forest Road’
data.description: In addition to transportation function in southern Thailand, road preserves natural beauty of surrounding environment
